WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, March 29th, 1864.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 131.

52. 1st Lieutenant Bird P. Brooks, 2d Kentucky Cavalry, is hereby honorably discharged the service of the United States, on account of phyiscal disability, from wounds received in action, with condition that he shall receive no final payments, until he has satisfied the Pay Department that he is not indebted to the Government.

By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
E. D. Townsend
Assistant Adjutant General.

2 Cavy
War Department
Adjutant Generals Office
Washington Mar 29. 1864

Townsend E. D.
A. A. G.
1st. Lieut Bird P. Brooks honorably discharged the service
